steps.title: Lay the dress flat on the floor or a countertop.
steps.content: Lay the dress flat on the floor or a countertop. Use your hands to smooth out the dress so it as flat as possible, with the front of the dress facing up. Make sure any ruffles or details on the bottom and straps of the dress lay flat. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Place the measuring tape on the top strap of a dress with straps.
steps.content: Place the measuring tape on the top strap of a dress with straps. Take a measuring tape made for garments and place one end on the top of one of the straps. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Measure from the top to the bottom edge of the dress.
steps.content: Measure from the top to the bottom edge of the dress. Extend the measuring tape horizontally from the top of the strap to the bottom edge. Note where the bottom edge hits on the measuring tape and record the measurement. [3] X Research source For a dress with sleeves, measure from the top of the shoulder seam down to the hem of the dress. [4] X Expert Source Andrea Beaulieu Professional Tailor & Fashion Designer Expert Interview. 1 May 2020. Most dresses are at least 30 inches (76 cm) in length and can be as long as 62 inches (160 cm) in length.

steps.title: Put on the dress and measure from the hollow of your neck if it is strapless.
steps.content: Put on the dress and measure from the hollow of your neck if it is strapless. Measuring a strapless dress must be done when you have it on. Place one end of the measuring tape at the center of your collarbone and then extend the tape down to the bottom edge of the dress to get the correct measurement. [5] X Research source You may need a friend to help you hold the measuring tape in place.

steps.title: Notice if the dress length is between 30 to 35 inches (76 to 89 cm).
steps.content: Notice if the dress length is between 30 to 35 inches (76 to 89 cm). If the total length of the dress falls within these measurements, it is a very short dress that will sit on the upper to mid thigh, known as a micro or mini dress. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Check if the dress measures between 36 to 40 inches (91 to 102 cm).
steps.content: Check if the dress measures between 36 to 40 inches (91 to 102 cm). This means the dress will sit just above the knee or just at the knee, known as a cocktail length dress. [7] X Research source If you are very tall or very short, the dress may hit you differently in the knee area depending on your height.

steps.title: Notice if the dress length is between 41 to 45 inches (100 to 110 cm).
steps.content: Notice if the dress length is between 41 to 45 inches (100 to 110 cm). This means the dress will fall just below the knee or at the calves, known as a midi dress. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Check if the dress measures between 55 to 62 inches (140 to 160 cm).
steps.content: Check if the dress measures between 55 to 62 inches (140 to 160 cm). This means the dress will be fairly long, falling at your ankles or to the floor, known as a maxi dress. [9] X Research source
